past simple and past participle of
froth
to (cause a liquid to) have or produce a lot of small bubbles that often rise to the surface: The waves frothed as they crashed onto the beach. When she opened and bottle of soda, it frothed up and spilled all over the table. froth at the mouth
If a person or animal froths at the mouth, a mass of small bubbles appears from their mouth as the result of a disease.
informal to be extremely angry
